articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Many airline services remain disrupted in the Middle East arising from the 12-day air war between Iran and Israel that ended with a U.S.-brokered ceasefire that took hold on Tuesday.
articles.title: Airlines suspend Middle East flights

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Jonathan Saul, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: Short of commanders, deprived of much of its tunnel network and unsure of support from its ally Iran, Hamas is battling to survive in Gaza in the face of rebellious local clans and relentless Israeli military pressure.
articles.title: Battling to survive, Hamas faces defiant clans and doubts over Iran

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: His comments come amid continuing questions about the state of Iran's nuclear program.
articles.title: No known intelligence that Iran moved uranium, US defense chief says

articles.author: David Latona, Marc Jones
articles.description: Scores of world leaders will be sweltering in the summer sun of southern Spain next week at a once-a-decade United Nations development financing summit aimed at curbing global poverty, disease and the worst-case threats of climate change.
articles.title: UN bids to salvage global development summit after US boycott

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte must be tried, and ultimately convicted, over serious charges, including an alleged threat to have the president killed, prosecutors argued in a submission to a Senate impeachment court on Friday.
articles.title: Philippines VP Duterte must go on trial due to severity of charges, prosecutors say

articles.author: A.J. Vicens, Raphael Satter
articles.description: After Israeli and American forces struck Iranian nuclear targets, officials in both countries sounded the alarm over potentially disruptive cyberattacks carried out by the Islamic Republic’s hackers.
articles.title: Iran's hackers keep a low profile after Israeli and US strikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British police have arrested four people in connection with a pro-Palestinian protest last week in which military planes were sprayed with paint at an air base in England, authorities said on Friday.
articles.title: UK police arrest four over pro-Palestinian protest at military base

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Anti-Muslim online posts targeting New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani have surged since his Democratic primary upset this week, including death threats and comments comparing his candidacy to the September 11, 2001 attacks, advocates said on Friday.
articles.title: Mamdani's NYC primary win sparks surge in anti-Muslim posts, advocates say

articles.author: Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Chinese diplomats and secret service followed Taiwan's Vice-President-elect Hsiao Bi-khim and planned to intimidate her physically when she visited Prague last year, Czech military intelligence said on Friday.
articles.title: Czechs say China followed, planned intimidation of Taiwan vice-president

articles.author: Mushtaq Ali
articles.description: At least nine people died when floodwaters swept away children in a river in northern Pakistan and relatives jumped into the water to try to save them on Friday, officials said.
articles.title: Nine dead as floodwaters sweep away children, relatives in Pakistan
